title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that architecture is an example of a material/human influence on the physical landscape.

Two points for explaining how architecture contributes to the cultural landscape, with reference to specific architectural styles or features shown Image 2.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways architecture contributes to the cultural landscape:
The response correctly states the following way architecture contributes to the cultural landscape:
The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways architecture contributes to the cultural landscape:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for describing one way in which new forms of cultural ideas and practices are socially constructed.

Two points for describing two ways in which new forms of cultural ideas and practices are socially constructed.

No more than one point for each of the categories.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the images fail to show the processes by which imperialism spread cultural traits.

Two points for explaining a specific example of a process or underlying relationship that is not illustrated by the images.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain the following processes by which imperialism spread cultural traits:
The response correctly states the following processes by which imperialism spread cultural traits:
The response correctly explains one of the following processes by which imperialism spread cultural traits:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that people may attribute meanings to shared public spaces.

Two points for explaining a specific way that people may attribute meanings to shared public spaces.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that shared public spaces contribute to a sense of place:
The response correctly states the following way that shared public spaces contribute to a sense of place:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that shared public spaces contribute to a sense of place:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that a national government can enact laws or policies that affect cultural landscapes.

Two points for explaining a specific type of law or policy that a country’s government can enact to express political power by altering cultural landscapes.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which a country’s government expresses political power by altering cultural landscapes:
The response correctly states the following degree to which a country’s government expresses political power by altering cultural landscapes:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which a country’s government expresses political power by altering cultural landscapes:
